title: The English Irish souldier with his new discipline, new armes, old stomacke, and new taken pillage: who had rather eate than fight.
publisher: for R. Wood, and A. Coe,
notes: Verse - "If any souldate think I do appeare,".
In two colums with a woodcut of the English Irish Souldier set between them.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
